item.title: eBay预计第一季度营收将超出预期
item.description: eBay公司周三预测第一季度营收将超出华尔街预期，表明其对奢侈品和汽车零部件等专业品类的聚焦策略，正助力其在充满挑战的电商市场中稳步前行。【原文：EBay Inc forecast first-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, signaling that its focus on specialty categories like luxury goods and auto parts is helping it navigate a challenging e-commerce market.】

item.title: Carvana第四季度利润因二手车需求激增而大幅攀升
item.description: 卡瓦纳周三公布第四季度利润和营收双增长，这家在线零售商受益于美国民众对二手车强劲的需求——民众正面临生活成本上涨和关税的连锁反应。【原文：Carvana reported higher fourth-quarter profit and revenue on Wednesday, as the online retailer benefited from strong demand for preowned vehicles from Americans battling higher cost of living and the trickle-down effects of tariffs.】

item.title: 菲格玛凭借强劲的设计势头预测全年营收向好，股价上涨
item.description: Figma周三公布的年度营收预期超出华尔街预期，这家设计软件制造商预计需求强劲，并押注其扩大用户群的努力，推动其股价在盘后交易中上涨约15%。【原文：Figma forecast annual revenue above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, as the design software maker anticipates robust demand and bets on its efforts to expand its user base, sending its shares up around 15% in extended trading.】

item.title: DoorDash预测季度利润低于预期，因技术改造支出增加
item.description: 外卖公司DoorDash预测第一季度调整后利润低于华尔街预期，原因是其在技术平台重大改造上的支出，而此时消费者对非必需品消费仍持谨慎态度。【原文：Food delivery company DoorDash forecast first-quarter adjusted profit below Wall Street estimates, hurt by spending on a major overhaul of its technology platform at a time when consumers remain cautious on discretionary purchases.】

item.title: 美联储称上月"利率检查"系应财政部要求
item.description: 美国央行周三证实，上月应美国财政部要求，曾向交易商征询美元兑日元汇率报价。这一不同寻常的举动强化了日元持续疲软的态势，并使投资者警惕美日两国可能实施15年来首次联合干预外汇市场的行动。【原文：The U.S. central bank on Wednesday confirmed it had asked dealers last month for quotes on dollar/yen rates at the behest of the U.S. Treasury, an unusual move that strengthened the stubbornly weak yen and put investors on alert for the first joint U.S.-Japan currency intervention in 15 years.】

item.title: 独家：美国计划建立在线门户网站，以规避欧洲及其他地区的内容禁令
item.description: 美国国务院正在开发一个在线门户网站，该网站将使欧洲及其他地区的人们能够查看被其政府封禁的内容，包括被指控的仇恨言论和恐怖主义宣传。三位熟悉该计划的消息人士称，华盛顿方面将此举视为对抗审查制度的一种方式。【原文：The U.S. State Department is developing an online portal that will enable people in Europe and elsewhere to see content banned by their governments including alleged hate speech and terrorist propaganda, a move Washington views as a way to counter censorship, three sources familiar with the plan said.】

item.title: 美国法官禁止前Palantir员工为新人工智能公司挖角
item.description: 曼哈顿一名联邦法官周三批准了Palantir Technologies公司的申请，禁止该公司前副总裁兼高级工程师招揽其员工加入他们去年创立的竞争对手公司Percepta AI。【原文：A federal judge in Manhattan on Wednesday granted Palantir Technologies' bid to block a former vice president and senior engineer from soliciting its employees to join the competing company they launched last year, Percepta AI.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利为爱泼斯坦信托基金开设账户的行为持续至2019年
item.description: 美国司法部公布的文件显示，摩根士丹利在2015年至2019年期间为杰弗里·爱泼斯坦的信托基金开设账户。而早在2008年，这位金融家就已根据认罪协议被定罪并登记为性犯罪者。【原文：Morgan Stanley opened accounts for Jeffrey Epstein's trusts between 2015 and 2019, years after the financier was convicted and registered as a sex offender under a 2008 plea deal, documents released by the U.S. Justice Department show.】

item.title: 澳大利亚电信公司Telstra下调全年业绩预期，中期利润超预期
item.description: 澳大利亚电信集团周四公布的半年利润超出预期，得益于其移动业务板块和成本控制，同时下调了2026财年的盈利预期。【原文：Australia's Telstra Group's half-year profit beat estimates on Thursday, supported by its mobile business segment and cost control, while tightening its earnings forecast for fiscal 2026.】

item.title: 墨西哥沃尔玛旗下沃尔玛墨西哥公司第四季度利润下滑4%，低于预期
item.description: 沃尔玛旗下墨西哥及中美洲业务部门Walmex（股票代码：WALMEX.MX）周三公布，其第四季度净利润较2024年同期下滑3.9%，未达分析师预期。【原文：Walmart's Mexico and Central America unit Walmex WALMEX.MXon Wednesday reported a 3.9% drop in its fourth-quarter net profit compared to the same period in 2024, missing analysts' forecasts.】

item.title: 德国政治家梅尔茨加入呼吁限制儿童使用社交媒体的行列
item.description: 德国财政部长弗里德里希·默茨支持国内日益高涨的呼声，主张对儿童使用社交媒体平台实施管控。他表示，鉴于虚假新闻的蓄意传播及其他网络操纵手段造成的危害证据日益充分，他越来越确信有必要实施强制性限制措施。【原文：Chancellor Friedrich Merz backed growing calls in Germany for controls on access to social media platforms by children, saying he had become increasingly persuaded of the need for compulsory limits by evidence of the harm done by the deliberate spreading of fake news and other forms of online manipulation.】

item.title: 联邦通信委员会主席支持Nexstar与Tegna合并案
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会主席周三表示，他支持Nexstar以35.4亿美元收购Tegna的提议，该交易完成后合并后的实体将成为美国最大的区域性电视台运营商。【原文：The chair of the Federal Communications Commission said Wednesday he supports Nexstar's proposed $3.54 billion acquisition of Tegna that would make the combined entity the largest U.S. regional TV station operator.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要淡化特朗普购房计划对住房可负担性的影响
item.description: 特朗普政府为降低住房贷款成本所做的努力迄今收效甚微，美联储周三公布的1月27日至28日会议纪要显示。【原文：An effort launched by the Trump administration to improve home borrowing costs is not coming to much so far, meeting minutes from the Federal Reserve’s January 27-28 meeting, released on Wednesday, said.】

item.title: 铜价因逢低买盘而攀升，科技股复苏
item.description: 周三铜价走高，从前一交易日逾一周低点反弹，因投资者逢低买入，且工业金属价格跟随科技股反弹走势。【原文：Copper rose higher on Wednesday, bouncing back from a more than one-week low in the previous session, as investors stepped in to buy the dip and as industrial metals prices tracked a rebound in tech stocks.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，雀巢正考虑减少对冰淇淋业务的投资。
item.description: 据彭博社周三报道，雀巢正考虑缩减其在冰淇淋业务中的规模，并一直在评估各种方案，包括可能减持其在Froneri的股份。【原文：Nestle is weighing a smaller presence in the ice cream business and has been reviewing options, including a possible reduction of its stake in Froneri, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 人工智能先驱李飞飞的World Labs公司完成10亿美元融资
item.description: 著名计算机科学家李飞飞创立的世界实验室周三宣布，在最新融资轮中筹集了10亿美元资金，以加速推进其"空间智能"技术研发。【原文：Prominent computer scientist Fei-Fei Li's World Labs raised $1 billion in a funding round as the startup accelerates its efforts to advance "spatial intelligence," it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 彭博社报道，埃利奥特推动伦敦证券交易所集团进行资产剥离，并实施50亿英镑的股票回购计划。
item.description: 据彭博社周三报道，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司正敦促伦敦证券交易所对其投资组合进行审查，并在未来一年内实施50亿英镑（约合67.6亿美元）的股票回购计划。该报道援引知情人士消息称。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management is urging London Stock Exchange to launch a review of its portfolio and pursue a 5 billion pound ($6.76 billion) share buyback over the next year, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 雀巢提议任命前瑞士央行行长托马斯·乔丹为董事会成员
item.description: 瑞士消费品巨头雀巢周三表示，已提议由瑞士国家银行前行长托马斯·乔丹加入其董事会，并计划全面改革公司治理实践。【原文：Swiss consumer goods giant Nestle said on Wednesday it has proposed former Swiss National Bank Chairman Thomas Jordan to serve on its board of directors and that it plans to overhaul the company's governance practices.】

item.title: 美国称石油公司必须向委内瑞拉政府缴纳当地税费
item.description: 美国财政部周三表示，在委内瑞拉石油行业经营的企业必须向委内瑞拉政府缴纳当地税款、许可证和费用，而特许权使用费和联邦税款则必须支付给美国管理的基金。【原文：The U.S. Treasury Department said on Wednesday that companies working in the Venezuelan oil business must pay local taxes, permits and fees to the government of Venezuela, while royalties and federal taxes must be paid into a fund managed by the United States.】

item.title: 储蓄平台Vestwell以20亿美元估值完成3.85亿美元融资
item.description: Vestwell在E轮融资中筹集了3.85亿美元，使这家数字储蓄平台的估值在两年多时间里翻倍至20亿美元。【原文：Vestwell raised $385 million in a Series E funding round, which doubled the valuation of the digital savings platform to $2 billion in over 2 years.】

item.title: 意大利品牌Cucinelli表示，已于1月底恢复向萨克斯百货供货。
item.description: 意大利奢侈品集团布鲁内罗·库奇内利表示，已于1月底恢复向萨克斯全球公司供货，并按时收到货款，且未因这家美国奢侈品零售商破产而遭受2026年的财务损失。【原文：Italian luxury group Brunello Cucinelli said it resumed shipments to Saks Global at the end of January, receiving regular payments, and saw no financial hit in 2026 from the U.S. luxury retailer's bankruptcy.】

item.title: 美国银行扩大忠诚度计划以吸引更多客户
item.description: 美国银行周三表示，计划推出一项新的忠诚度计划，将奖励范围扩大至更多客户。当前美国银行机构正竞相深化与零售客户的关系。【原文：Bank of America plans to launch a new loyalty program that will extend rewards to a wider range of customers, it said on Wednesday, as U.S. lenders race to deepen relationships with retail clients.】

item.title: 研究发现数百万美国医疗保险优势计划参保者被迫更换保险计划
item.description: 据周三发表于医学期刊的一项研究显示，随着健康保险公司退出市场并缩减计划选项，近300万参加医疗保险优势计划的人——约占该私营管理项目参保总人数的10%——在2026年不得不另寻替代保险。【原文：Nearly 3 million people with Medicare Advantage plans - or about 10% of all enrollees in the privately-managed program - had to find alternative coverage in 2026, as health insurers exited markets and scaled back plan options, according to a study published in a medical journal on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称美国炼油商菲利普斯66和雪佛龙旗下Citgo寻求直接从委内瑞拉购买原油
item.description: 知情人士透露，美国炼油商菲利普斯66公司和雪佛龙石油公司正寻求从4月起直接向委内瑞拉国家石油公司PDVSA采购重质原油，以实现利润最大化，而非通过贸易公司或美国石油巨头雪佛龙进行采购。【原文：U.S. refiners Phillips 66 and Citgo Petroleum are seeking to buy heavy crude directly from Venezuelan state oil company PDVSA starting in April to maximize profits, rather than purchasing through trading houses and U.S. oil major Chevron , according to sources familiar with the efforts.】

item.title: 星巴克投资者团体敦促股东更换董事以解决劳资纠纷
item.description: 星巴克周三面临新一轮压力，包括公共部门养老基金在内的一批投资者联合敦促股东投票反对两名董事连任，理由是该公司持续未能妥善处理劳资关系。【原文：Starbucks faced fresh pressure on Wednesday from a coalition of investors including public-sector pension funds that urged shareholders to vote against the reelection of two directors, citing persistent failure to manage labor relations.】

item.title: 稀土价格突破MP材料公司设定的价格底线
item.description: 两种关键稀土元素的价格持续攀升，这些元素对制造电动汽车和国防设备中使用的超强磁铁至关重要。强劲需求与供应瓶颈共同推高了价格，使其突破了美国去年为矿商MP Materials设定的历史性价格底线。【原文：Prices of two key rare earths, crucial for making super-strong magnets used in EVs and defence equipment, have rallied on firm demand and bottlenecks in supply, above a ground-breaking price floor provided by the U.S. last year to miner MP Materials.】

item.title: 爱尔兰财政部称，人工智能应用已冲击毕业生就业岗位
item.description: 爱尔兰财政部研究发现，初步证据表明人工智能正在削弱该国技术导向型经济中某些领域的就业机会，特别是对年轻毕业生而言。【原文：Early evidence suggests artificial intelligence is weakening employment opportunities in some parts of Ireland's technology-focused economy, particularly for young graduates, research by Ireland's finance department found.】

item.title: 加拿大将加大对乌克兰能源领域的投资力度
item.description: 加拿大将加大对乌克兰能源领域的支持力度，与该国产业界合作，以优惠条件供应石油和天然气设备，并推动可再生能源投资。两国政府周三宣布了这一决定。【原文：Canada will step up support to Ukraine's energy sector, working with industry to supply oil and gas equipment on favourable terms and boost renewable energy investments, the two governments said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 微软将继续购买足够的可再生能源，以满足其全部电力需求。
item.description: 微软承诺将继续采购足够的可再生能源以满足其全部电力需求——去年该公司首次实现了这一目标。与此同时，科技巨头们正加大资本支出，推动由人工智能驱动的、对电力需求巨大的数据中心扩张。【原文：Microsoft has promised to keep buying enough renewable energy to match all its electricity needs after meeting that goal for the first time last year, as tech giants ramp up capital expenditure on an AI-fuelled expansion of power-hungry data centres.】

item.title: Snap的直接收入达到10亿美元的年化运行率，订阅用户突破2500万
item.description: Snap周三表示，其直接营收业务已实现10亿美元的年化营收运行率，这主要得益于Snapchat+订阅服务的增长。这家社交媒体公司正致力于开拓广告之外的新收入来源。【原文：Snap said on Wednesday its direct-revenue business has reached $1 billion in annualized revenue run rate, driven by growth in its Snapchat+ subscription service, as the social media company pushes into new income streams beyond advertising.】
